meanings.definition: A deep-seated feeling of dislike or aversion.
meanings.sent1: Her antipathies towards spiders made her shiver at the sight of one.
meanings.sent2: The siblings' antipathies towards each other were evident in their constant arguments.
meanings.sent3: Despite their antipathies, they managed to work together on the project.
meanings.sent4: The antipathies between the two rival gangs led to frequent clashes.
meanings.sent5: His antipathies towards broccoli were so strong that he refused to even look at it.

meanings.definition: Strongly opposed or averse to something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's antipathies towards cheating students were well-known among the class.
meanings.sent2: She was antipathies to the idea of leaving her beloved hometown.
meanings.sent3: His antipathies to early mornings often resulted in him being late for work.
meanings.sent4: The cat showed clear antipathies towards the new puppy in the house.
meanings.sent5: The antipathies reaction to the proposal surprised everyone in the room.
